body:
For the overlapping binaries problem please see `nbbuild/antsrc/org/netbeans/nbbuild/extlibs/ignored-overlaps` to define an exception. If multiple modules need the same binary a common wrapper module should be created to hold that dependencies and the others depend on that module.
And yes, the headers of the license file need to be separated from the actual license text by an empty line.
Hi @matthiasblaesing , thanks for your review! I've removed the license from the QT files and added a licenseinfo.xml for these files with GUI_USABILITY. Let me know if this is correct.

Thanks for changes.  I retriggered a couple of tests on Travis which can be a little unstable.  However, I think the commit-validation might be legit - could you take a look?

Assuming we get tests green, and @geertjanw handles merging, consider my -1 withdrawn.

Indeed, I'm not entirely sure how the plugin update should be done. Should the plugin be part of `java.kit` or something else or should it have `AutoUpdate-Essential-Module=true` (which I never used honestly)?
Thanks, @matthiasblaesing. Let me learn all about the surprsing "Squash and merge" magic button before hitting it...

@matthiasblaesing yes, I've read your understandable concerns about this in the mailing list.
I talked with ASF Infra about this and they suggested talking to dev@community.apache.org instead (https://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/community-dev//202104.mbox/browser), I've just emailed them.  Let's see what they have to say.
I suggest to clean this up, remove all unnessary changes, squash and force push. I also notice, that no reference to an issue is given, so the changes are not tracked in jira.

Dependency from `java.kit` is one (not very nice, as it makes the module kind of required) option. The other one is to make this module `is.autoload=true` and provides a token that `java.platform` module requires:
```
OpenIDE-Module-Recommends: org.netbeans.modules.java.platform.ui
```
Try this provides/recommends approach, please.
Would this need a new Beta to be created to support VSNetBeans? (And a new vote thread etc?)
Catching up with e-mails, I see [PR-2864](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/2864) ... so this one is probably obsolete. Sorry - feel free to close.
Yes, no `delivery` branch until freeze - #2866 is opened to sync release from master and give us a git hash. Thanks!
D'oh! It seems the public name/email address in github has to be set _before_ the PR is done. Sorry by that!
Thanks for the review, @matthiasblaesing . Merging.
We might consider the .mailmap file option as well? Should tidy up the history.

@matthiasblaesing The fact is that I did have a public name/email address available, but it seems this has to be public _before_ the PR is made somehow. Otherwise it won't be taken into account. So my level of trust with github's squash and merge is zero now.
@neilcsmith-net I'm not sure a .mailmap will help, but let me know how I can set it up and we can give it a run.
@vieiro maybe https://git-scm.com/docs/gitmailmap or check across ASF repos. Few projects have this set to map github private emails, etc. to the right person / email.

The author of this PR is not a committer, so two things are required:

1. A committer, that actually does the commit and
2. Ensures, that the author is aware, that he donates the change to the ASF (as the license headers of the files state) or if there is not enough content there to warant copyright.

It would be good if one of the reviewers could take this task. Thank you!
Let's merge and move onto to the next one, then! Thanks for the review, Matthias!
Thanks!
Thank you @JaroslavTulach, I've done that. Hopefully the builds will be pleased with the PR.

> Hopefully the builds will be pleased with the PR.

You can always verify locally using `ant commit-validation`.

> 
> 
> The author of this PR is not a committer, so two things are required:
> 
>     1. A committer, that actually does the commit and
> 
>     2. Ensures, that the author is aware, that he donates the change to the ASF (as the license headers of the files state) or if there is not enough content there to warant copyright.
> 
> 
> It would be good if one of the reviewers could take this task. Thank you!

Thanks for the comment. I understand that I am donating to ASF. Akshay and Akhilesh from the team have reviewed the PR and will be doing the commit.
Recommitted with the necessary `project.{xml,properties}` changes. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Nicely done, thank you.

And everything works exactly as before with this change?

As far as I could test, yes!
I built my branch and ran "ant tryme", activated the Tomcat plugin, added a new Tomcat 9 instance, started it, opened the "webapps" node (which is where it failed before), and stopped.
Everything went fine on JDK 11.

Unfortunately "ant tryme" segfaults on JDK16 and I can't figure out why (yet).
This is not the correct solution. I will re-work it.

I think the last failing test is *not* caused by my PR. I see

>  9029.20 Test Java modules without nb-javac on Java 14

is failing
This would be very helpful. Maybe change the testMethod in GeneralOptions too, to allow 301 - Moved Permanently as a successfull response (in case this happens again)
I'm not sure if allowing 301 - Moved Permanently would be correct. Could a misconfigured proxy use that in some case?

> I suggest to clean this up, remove all unnessary changes, squash and force push. 

Sorry, I've not done a lot of squashing and force pushes.  Any guidance or pointers to that?  

Is that something doable within github, Netbeans git, or git command prompt verIon?

> no reference to an issue is given, so the changes are not tracked in jira.

As indicate, I've added the ticket reference [NETBEANS-189] to the PR title and the PR is linked on the NETBEANS ticket.  Let me know if anything else is needed here.

> > I suggest to clean this up, remove all unnessary changes, squash and force push.
> 
> Sorry, I've not done a lot of squashing and force pushes. Any guidance or pointers to that?
> 
> Is that something doable within github, Netbeans git, or git command prompt verIon?

I think the git integration in netbeans is missing a force-push option, so I would use the git cli client:

https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Tools-Rewriting-History

After the history is cleaned up, you can do a forced push to the tracking branch on github and the PR will be updated with that.

The intention is here to get a clean baseline (and loose all unintended changes) and should be used with care.

Okay apparently the adding of the notification as part of ide/db.sql.editor/src/org/netbeans/modules/db/sql/editor/completion/SQLCompletionQuery.java broke unit tests.  I believe the problem has to do with the dialog opening and waiting for someone to click the button.  I assume may need to back this out and/or find a better place to trigger the notification.
Would it be possible to also write a test for the change ?

Note: there are other impls and usages of Base54 encoders throughout the codebase:
- `org.netbeans.modules.proxy.Base64Encoder`
- `org.netbeans.modules.diff.builtin.Base64`
- `org.netbeans.modules.db.util.Base64`

Shouldn't they be reviewed, deprecated and/or replaced by j.u.Base64 usage ?

There is one already actually, it's in org.netbeans.modules.java.source.save.FormatingTest in the "Java Source Base" module. At the moment it crashes and with my incorrect solution in this PR is doesn't crash but it fails(!). But I have got it to pass now.
@DevCharly please rebase this PR on release124 branch.
Please don't! We're merging to master until freeze, then we'll have a delivery branch as previously.
I'm sorry. You are right. Should have waited till my morning tea kicks in.

Indeed it would be good to remove the referenced implementation or at least make them shims to call into the JDK implementation (if they are API). I had a quick look at all three implementations though and all of them are full implementations and don't call into restricted JDK apis.

@piercemar would you be willing to have a look?

Two other things:

- The author information is invalid - the email address is not valid (looks like an edit on github, if you work on github please ensure, that your full name is publically visible _and_ and valid public emailaddress is set).
- it is assumed, that you had a look at the license statement of the files you changed and agree, that your changes are donated to the ASF.

@matthiasblaesing, sure I can have a look.
About the author information, I'm no git(hub) guru. Here's how I plan to fix it :
* Disable e-mail privacy in GH settings
* setup my public e-mail in my git config
* squash my commits into one
* amend author information
* force push to my branch

But it's going to affect this PR history. Is it good ?

Should work, though I don't trust anything github offers regarding working with history. They try to do too much magic. Feel free to use this PR as a playground - it is simple enough, that if all fails, can be redone.
I've squashed most of the changes together.  So hopefully it's just about ready fro inclusion.
would it be possible to merge this to the LTS branch, too?

I've re-done it now so the individual test passes. However there are some other tests in the same 'FormatingTest' file which fail (they did before and still do). I haven't studied each one thoroughly but for example one is the formatting for switch expressions (using arrow syntax). Here the syntax tree passed to the reformatter contains elements described as "(ERROR)" - I assume these are because I am using JDK 11 which doesn't have switch expressions. Is there a way to skip tests based on the JDK used (or another way to fix, or actually do you want them to stay as failures)? Thanks!

> The only thing I'd like to see is add braces to the blocks of the if statements.

Done

```
Test org.netbeans.core.netigso.EnabledAutoloadTest FAILED
```

I hope I got it right this time.
Base64Encoder was more broadly used than I first thought.
I replaced trivial usage directly by j.u.Base64, but for other cases, I first extracted the call to in-house codecs into a package-private static method, so i could create a unit test for it, and then replaced the implementation by j.u.Base64, ensuring there's no regression due to different encoding or other subtleties.
Author information fixed (had to force push again)
It seems Gradle 7.0 is out. I'm going to update this one to contain the GA release artifacts.

All checks pass!

Does this mean the PR is finally mergeable?
I'd say, yes. Unless someone objects, I will merge 24 hours from now.
I retriggered the failing test the other day. I'm happy if @geertjanw merges (from provenance point of view, not tested functionality). @matthiasblaesing ?

First [error is reported](https://travis-ci.com/github/apache/netbeans/jobs/498248762) and it can be interpreted as the power of `--release` option!
```
Class org.netbeans.lib.profiler.utils.ImmutableList
  "E1.2 - API type removed" : method public java.util.Spliterator java.lang.Iterable.spliterator()
  "E1.2 - API type removed" : method public void java.lang.Iterable.forEach(java.util.function.Consumer)
```
The `lib.profiler` project sets `javac.target=1.7` and SigTest version 1.4 properly sees only JDK7 APIs now!

Looks a good move!  I was just going to liaise with @geertjanw about the API snapshot, which for 12.3 we did initially before freeze so we could get useful review.  Is this intended for 12.4?  Should we wait until this merges?
OK, merging.

@junichi11 @tmysik I'd like to integrate this change to 12.4. Will you manage to review this PR?
CI failure seems not related to changes here.
@pedro-w not sure, the testsuite should be run (?) with nb-javac that should understand switch exprs even on JDK11 ... // cc: @jlahoda

It is possible, though, to run it without nb-javac and I believe it does make sense to test the code without as the users might be running NB without nb-javac.
What I found is that only one additional test was failing (the switch expression one) and that test did not have a version check in it, whereas the other tests in the same file did. I guess it was just missed out by accident?
So, I copy-pasted the check from another function in the file and that is commit 8add5a26905d05ad16b7f8c9f5f4c4c3f323dcd0
With this, all tests in the file pass for me.
I also added another clean up commit to the test file - 233ae402baa0682ac164517495745af6a518842f - I limited this to just the things the IDE flagged up (obsolete API, unused functions etc.) I don't know if you want this as it doesn't add a huge amount of benefit to the code!
Please let me know,

This can IMHO have some unexpected consequences, i.e. our famous issues with Gradle project trust: as soon as the user upgrades ASF NBJLS extension, his/her approvals will be gone. Now that particular question does not appear that often, but  still...
I can see considerable benefit when switching either from a stable TO a **development** version or maybe between development versions, less when switching between _released_ versions. It's also perfectly OK for the cachedir.

Could there be at least an (optional) setting where the user (config) dir is, so it could be possibly overriden ?

> considerable benefit when switching either from a stable TO a **development** version or maybe between development versions, less when switching between _released_ versions

Right. This feature is (hopefully) only needed for the development builds - at least the reports we have so far concern only dev builds. The question is: how to identify dev vs. release build?

I don't think `CaseTree.getExpressions` should return list which contains `null`. The bug is more likely in `java/java.source.base/src/org/netbeans/modules/java/source/TreeShims.java`, method `getExpressions`, in case of `NoSuchMethodException`, it returns:
```
return Collections.singletonList(node.getExpression());
```

But it should rather do something like:
```
return node.getExpression() != null ? Collections.singletonList(node.getExpression()) : Collections.emptyList();
```

As `CaseTree.getExpression()` historically returned `null` for default, but `getExpressions()` is intended to return empty lists instead.
@jlahoda is your recommendation to drop this PR altogether and modify TreeShims.java instead? That looks straightforward for me to do.

Separating dev and release in VSCode can be hard. userdir is named just by extension inside Code/user/globalStorage. And naming the VSIX like asf.apache-netbeans-java-dev will be counterproductive as you will always have to uninstall release version when trying dev. ...
This does not seem controversial, so will merge this, or @JaroslavTulach, feel free to merge, when all checks pass.

The test introduced in ca25974 [shows](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/2882/checks?check_run_id=2353181954) that `emplates/XML/XMLDocument.xml` in ide cluster cannot be instantiated without providing `fileEncoding` property. Let's fix it in 924c44c.
If this conflict is fixed, we can merge it, @jlahoda, or should we close it?
Should this go in for 12.4 or should we delay for 12.5? I.e., @jlahoda, feel free to make a choice above and just let's go with that.
@junichi11 @tmysik Thank you.
Maybe @geertjanw and @neilcsmith-net  want to include this within the new release. Once upon a time we had labels for this, but I cannot find the proper one right now...
@vieiro just merge to master, branching of the release has not happened yet
Sounds good!  One of my platform application build files has `-J-Dnetbeans.exception.report.min.level=99999` in it - I guess this must have annoyed me a lot at one point. :smile:
Ah, good to know. I thought we did already fork for next release. Anyway they can cherry-pick later on if they want. Merging then...
This PR reverts the update of JavaFX from 14 to 16. I tested, that with this applied the Java Frontend Application Wizard works again.
@junichi11 Could you please check the CI failures?
@tmysik I think there is no problem because it's Java area(9082.24 Test Java modules without nb-javac on Java 15). Just in case, I'll restart the job. Thank you!

@tmysik 
Feature freeze is 18:00 CET (Friday 16 April). https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rb1b2865c1ca6bd962618b79b2e0c97e0d134a03a05fbfe14a2823c20%40%3Cdev.netbeans.apache.org%3E

So, I think this is too late (and sorry for the huge changes), but could you please review it if you have time? If you don't have time, I'll change the milestone to 12.5, then let's merge this later. (Need not hurry :) It's all my fault.) 
Thanks.
Let's wait, I guess.
All CI failed at different issues, mostly green, merging.

Had to upgrade OSGi as well, Felix 7.0 seems to require OSGI 8 core. `osgi-cmp` remains at 7.0 (Compendium 8.0 spec is still draft) while `osgi-core` 8.0 was released in December 2020.

Please re-review.

> Would having a test failing on JDK16 before and succeeding with this change be beneficial?

Can you suggest how to proceed with such test implementation ? i.e. two variants of the Felix (OSGi ?) library wrapper modules - how ? Or some simpler way ?

> Can you suggest how to proceed with such test implementation ? ... Or some simpler way ?

The problems only appears on JDK16, right? We should have JDK16 gate running commit validation and failing with some older commit like 5a9c949e8e4e282 - then apply this PR and the gate starts passing. Simple.
Changing milestone to 12.5.
OK, merging for inclusion in 12.4.
Should this be merged, please go ahead, if so, @JaroslavTulach @sdedic.
Changing milestone to 12.5.
There are conflicts to be resolved here. Changing milestone to 12.5.
Seems to be no clarity on this yet, are we sure this fixes the stated problem, and won't lead to side effects? Changing milestone to 12.5.
Looks like great changes but indeed let's change milestone to 12.5.
Changing milestone to 12.5.
@geertjanw OK. Thanks!
Changing milestone to 12.5.
Is this ready to merge, for 12.4 inclusion, please do so if so @JaroslavTulach @sdedic.

@geertjanw We can merge it into the `master` branch after the `delivery` branch is created, right?

@tmysik Let's merge it later because the milestone is changed to 12.5 :)

I've implemented it the way that @jlahoda suggested, please see https://github.com/apache/netbeans/compare/master...pedro-w:ALT-NETBEANS-4569 . Is that a better fix than this one?
Let me know,
@junichi11, after the delivery branch is created, we can merge into that branch for inclusion in 12.4, or into master for inclusion in 12.5.
If @tmysik reviews this in time, I think we should try to include this in 12.4, if you agree.
@geertjanw I see. Thank you.

>  after the delivery branch is created, we can merge into that branch for inclusion in 12.4,

IMO, it might be better to merge before freeze, review and get testing in the first RC than drop it in later?  Can always revert or tidy up by RC2 if necessary.
